intro: Satyrium henryi, commonly known as Henry's satyr, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale green, often with a subtle fragrance. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
